intro: [WRONG START] Stelis deuteroadrianaa, commonly known as the Adriatic stelis, is a member of the Orchidaceae family. It is a small, epiphytic orchid that typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant features a short, creeping rhizome with a single, erect stem bearing several leaves. Its flowers are small and usually white or pale green, with a distinctive lip that is often marked with purple or brown. This species is native to parts of Southeast Europe and is noted for its delicate appearance and specific habitat requirements.
